page.title: 16Farming in South Bradford.
page.content: Up to{1939}there were about{14 farms,} average size 40 acres,in the vicinity of East Bierley.These small farms were mainly concerned with{dairying}and the growing of{corn and wheat.}Root crop growing often provided food for cattle therefore growing{mangolds}was popular.The soil is generally quite poor and stoney being boulder clay. After the 2nd World War many small farms went out of business because of a shortage of cheap labour and the raising of rents.By the{1950's}only a {few}local{farms}existed.Dairying and agricultural farming are the main forms of farming today with considerable areas given over to grass growing for{hay}making and{silage.} There are{now}only{2 farms}in our 'block'.Any other farms are now smallholdings or specialist grass growing.
